newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-BHP Minerals says eyes larger projects.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-BHP Minerals says eyes larger projects.

text.p: The Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd said on Tuesday its minerals division would look beyond traditional businesses to a new range of large scale projects in order to build on its strong performance in fiscal 1995/96.

In the year to May 31, BHP Minerals achieved an 11.9 percent rise in profit to A$1.078 billion, on the back of higher price and shipments for most of its commodities, plus an abnormal profit of A$65 million.
The division planned to target a range of commodities for future growth including diamonds, platinum, titanium, silver, lead and zinc, BHP said in its 1995/96 annual report.
BHP Minerals' current product portfolio is centred around steelmaking raw materials and gold.
The group's growth strategy would focus on exploration, strategic business alliances and development of technical expertise, BHP said.
"It is invigorating its world class steelmaking raw materials operations and expanding through increased downstream processing and a worldwide marketing network," it said.
At 1.23 p.m. (0323 GMT) BHP shares were down 12 cents to A$17.46.
